alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 6:33PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Norton and eastern Decatur Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 633 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jennings, or 13 miles southeast of Oberlin, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Norton and eastern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Kanona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
